meanings.definition: To apply fresh bait to a trap or hook.
meanings.sent1: She was rebaiting the fishing hook with a juicy worm.
meanings.sent2: The fisherman rebaited his hook to attract more fish.
meanings.sent3: After rebaiting the trap, the mouse seemed even more curious.
meanings.sent4: The idea of rebaiting the situation with a new approach excited her.
meanings.sent5: He rebaited the trap with such care that even the cleverest mouse couldn't resist.

meanings.sent1: The angler was rebaiting his fishing line for better luck.

meanings.sent4: The idea of rebaiting their friendship with shared memories brought a smile to her face.
meanings.sent5: By rebaiting the trap, he ensured a steady stream of visitors to his garden.
